thread.title: Texans OLB Jadeveon Clowney out with ankle injury
thread.title_full: Texans OLB Jadeveon Clowney out with ankle injury - UPI.com

author: upi.com
title: Texans OLB Jadeveon Clowney out with ankle injury
text:
| License Photo Houston Texans outside linebacker Jadeveon Clowney was ruled out Friday with a sprained ankle for Sunday's game against the Jacksonville Jaguars.
Clowney suffered the injury on Oct. 8 against the Indianapolis Colts. The next day after the Thursday night game, Clowney wore a walking boot on his right foot and a few days later he wore a brace on his ankle to practice. He missed all of this week's practices.
Clowney has 12 tackles and a forced fumble for the Texans this season after missing 12 games of his rookie year.
The 22-year-old Clowney, the No. 1 overall pick in last year's draft, returned this season after undergoing microfracture knee surgery last December.
The Texans also listed defensive end Jared Crick as questionable because of a knee injury that kept him out of practice this week. Safety Quintin Demps and wide receiver Nate Washington were ruled out with hamstring injuries.
  Texans' Clowney questionable vs. Eagles Clowney leaves game vs. Redskins Jadeveon Clowney limping around with ankle injury Clowney to miss minicamp after sports hernia surgery
